question: Ten identical cells each emf 2V and internal resistance 1 <katex>$\Omega$</katex> are connected in series with two cells wrongly connected. A resistor of 10 <katex>$\Omega$</katex> is connected to the combination. What is the current through the resistor?
explanation: Total cells n = 10. Wrongly connected m = 2. Effective emf <katex>$E_{eff} = (n - 2m)E = (10 - 4) \times 2 = 12$</katex> V. Total resistance <katex>$R_{total} = R + nr = 10 + 10(1) = 20 \Omega$</katex>. Current <katex>$I = 12/20 = 0.6$</katex> A.
